carlhauser_server.Helpers.arg_parser.parse_conf_files(args) -> (<class 'carlhauser_server.Configuration.database_conf.Default_database_conf'>, <class 'carlhauser_server.Configuration.distance_engine_conf.Default_distance_engine_conf'>, <class 'carlhauser_server.Configuration.feature_extractor_conf.Default_feature_extractor_conf'>, <class 'carlhauser_server.Configuration.webservice_conf.Default_webservice_conf'>)[source]¶

Parse args to configuration files, if they exist. Usage example : db_conf, dist_conf, fe_conf, ws_conf = arg_parser.parse_conf_files(args) :param args: parsed arguments from command line :return: db_conf, dist_conf, feature_conf, webservice_conf

carlhauser_server.Helpers.socket module¶

class carlhauser_server.Helpers.socket.Socket(socket_path: pathlib.Path, script_folder_path: pathlib.Path)[source]¶

Bases: object

Socket handler to a redis database

flush()[source]¶

Flush the database behind the given socket :return: Nothing

get_access(decode_responses=True) → redis.client.Redis[source]¶

Get an access to the redis database behind the given socket :return: A redis object linked to a redis instance

is_running() → bool[source]¶

Check if the database is running behind the given socket. Peform only one test :return: True if the behind instance is running, False otherwise

launch()[source]¶

Launch the database behind the given socket :return: Nothing

prevent_workers_stop()[source]¶

Remove “Halt” key in database to prevent workers to stop on launch :return: nothing

run_script(script_path: pathlib.Path)[source]¶

Run a given script file (bash) :param script_path: File of the script to run :return: Nothing

shutdown()[source]¶

Stop the database behind the given socket :return: Nothing

stop_workers()[source]¶

Put “Halt” key in database to notify workers to stop :return: nothing

wait_until_running(timeout: int = 60) → bool[source]¶

Wait until the database behind the given socket is launched (= answer to a ping) Put timeout -1 if you don’t want to function to timeout :param timeout: The time after which we consider the database as down, without answer :return: True if the behind instance is running, False otherwise

wait_until_stopped(timeout: int = 60) → bool[source]¶

Wait until the database is stopped (= does not answer to a ping) Put timeout -1 if you don’t want to function to timeout :param timeout: The time after which we consider the database as still up, without answer :return: True if the behind instance is stopped, False otherwise
